Working in the Project Pane

The Project pane displays open project databases and projects.

Project Databases

Project databases are represented by the following icons:

Open project database. When you open a project database, the name and location of the project database are shown next to the icon. When you open a project database that was created using an earlier release of Version Manager, only the location of the project database is shown.
Active project database. A project database is active when the project database or an item within the project database is selected.

Projects

Projects are represented by the following icons:

A project or subproject.
A configured project. These configuration settings override configuration settings inherited from the project database.
A project assigned an access control database in which you have not been defined, and therefore do not have privileges to access.
A 5.3/6.0 project or folder.
A configured 5.3/6.0 project. These configuration settings override configuration settings inherited from the project database.
A 5.3 project assigned an access control database in which you have not been defined, and therefore do not have privileges to access.

From the Project pane, you can:

  • Expand and collapse the view of project databases, projects, and subprojects.
  • Right-click My Project Databases to access a context menu, which provides a quick way to create or open a project database.
  • Right-click a project database or project to access a context menu, which provides access to frequently used functions.
  • Drag and drop projects to other project databases or projects. Dragging and dropping projects enables you to create a new copy of the projects or share the archives between project databases.
  • Drag and drop 6.0 projects into project databases to take advantage of the new functionality.
  • Resize the width or height of the Project pane.
  • Select multiple projects to perform an action on.
